intro: Lindernia elata, commonly known as the common lindernia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 10 to 30 centimeters. The plant features opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, tubular flowers in shades of purple or pink. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Lindernia elata is also known for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
